data.eligibility: All Small Scale Industries (SSIs) will get the benefit under this scheme. CETPs must be located in industrial estates or clusters of SSIs.
data.conditions:
1. All MSMEs registered with the UDYAM registration portal (of the MoMSME) will be eligible. 
  2. Entrepreneur's Contribution: 20% of the project cost. 
  3. The CETP project must be recommended by the State Pollution Control Board (SPCB) for environmental compliance. 
  4. Legal agreement must be signed between the CETP and the member units for smooth operation. 
  5. Clearances must be obtained from the State Pollution Control Board (SPCB) for discharging treated effluent and handling hazardous waste.

data.nodal_agency: Department of Central Pollution Control Board
data.context: This Scheme is started by Ministry of environment forest and climate change, launched in year 1991, as an act as a step towards cleaner environment and service to the society at large.
data.objective:
Projects for assistance will be prioritised on the basis of:
 - Toxicity of pollutants
 - Pollution load being generated and to be treated; and
 - Number of units covered The scheme must have the technical recommendation of the State Pollution Control Boards.
data.description:
• Pattern of Financial Assistance: - 
  • State subsidy: 25% of project cost 
  • Central subsidy: 25% of project cost 
  • Entrepreneurs contribution: 20% of project cost 
  • Loan from financial institutions: 30% of project cost.
data.how_to_apply:
The eligible entity shall apply through Offline State Pollution Control Board
Application format - https://pharmaceuticals.gov.in/sites/default/files/Approved%20Operational%20Guidelines%20%20%28PRIP%29.pdf  
Page - 43-45
data.funding_facilitator: Department of Central Pollution Control Board
data.funding_mechanism:
The assistance will be released in four equal installments. 
The first installment of 25% of the assistance will be released when a body has been identified for the purpose of implementing the project.
data.additional_info:
1. CETP companies can fund their projects using their own resources, with entrepreneurs contributing 50% of the cost if they do not seek loans. 
  2. Central assistance of up to 25% of the total CETP cost is available, provided the SG matches the grant. 
  3. The CETP must cover the remaining cost through equity and loans. 
  4. Central assistance is only for capital costs, not recurring expenses.
data.checklist_info_a:
Project Plan: A detailed plan of the proposed project.
Sludge Management Plan: A plan detailing how sludge from the treatment process will be managed.
Feasibility Report: A report that assesses the feasibility of the proposed project.
Clearance Certificate: A certificate from the State Pollution Control Board for all hazardous waste facilities.
KYC Documents: Know Your Customer (KYC) documents for identification purposes.
